roleset.name: to get stuck

example.name: transitive
example.text: Douglas Stoneman , vice president of Shell Canada , noted that producers would prefer [*-2] to avoid hearings into competing proposals that [*T*-1] would lengthen the regulatory review process and bog down development .

example.name: intransitive
example.text: [*-2] Taken [*-1] together , the auto-sales and durable-goods reports confirmed perceptions that the economy is bogging down .

roleset.note: Frames file for 'bog' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. Frames created by Olga

roleset.name: results in
roleset.note: Based on Bolt data. No comparison. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: Therefore, this all bogs down to a new economic system.

example.name: like 'boils down'
example.text: I have to believe this bogs down to two main things

example.name: draw a conclusion
example.text: All this bogs down to a painting theft.
